oai_dc:dc.dc:title: OPTIMIZING DUMPING SITES NEAR DREDGED CHANNELS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kogel, Ulrich
Ohlmeyer, Friedrich
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dredged channel
dumping site
optimized dumping
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To maintain the depth of the deepwater channel of the Elbe-Waterway extensive dredging has to be done permanently. Dumping should be optimized, choosing sites near the dredging area but with a small risk of recirculation of the dumped material. In order to estimate this risk field measurements with current meters and radioactive tracer tests in field and model were carried out.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 19 (1984): Proceedings of 19th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Houston, Texas, 1984.; 211
